title: Former governor meets with Russian leadership as Griner and Whelan remain detained
description: Former Gov. Bill Richardson and his team were in Moscow this week and held meetings with Russian leadership, CNN has learned.

title: Judge unseals less redacted version of affidavit used for Mar-a-Lago search warrant
description: A newly unsealed version of the affidavit that federal investigators used to secure a search warrant for Mar-a-Lago revealed some previously unknown details about the classified materials that former President Donald Trump gave to the Justice Department under subpoena in June.

title: Twitter whistleblower says company is a decade behind industry security standards
description: CNN's Donie O'Sullivan reports on the Senate hearing where Twitter whistleblower Peiter "Mudge" Zatko told lawmakers about huge security vulnerabilities at the company that he called "a danger to democracy."

title: This new iOS feature could save you from an embarrassing moment
description: HLN's Maribel Aber breaks down a key new iPhone feature that could save users from awkward moments.

title: Passenger sentenced to 4 months in prison for interfering with flight crew
description: A New York City woman was recently sentenced to four months in prison for interference with flight crew members, according to a Department of Justice news release.

title: Putin is fooling no one -- certainly not Xi
description: The last time Russian President Vladimir Putin met with his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, the future looked very different. Putin was still denying he planned to invade Ukraine, which he did within days of attending the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing in February. Xi and Putin stood together, autocracy brothers ready to take on the West. They declared their relationship had "no limits."

title: Tow truck lifts massive alligator out of Texas neighborhood
description: This 10-foot alligator was so massive that a tow truck had to remove it from a neighborhood outside Houston, Texas. HLN's Robin Meade has the story.

title: Ken Starr, independent counsel who investigated President Clinton, dies
description: Kenneth Winston Starr, a former US solicitor general who gained worldwide fame in the 1990s as the independent counsel who doggedly investigated President Bill Clinton during a series of political scandals, has died. He was 76.

title: CEO calls out misleading studies on efficacy of working from home
description: Ed Zitron, founder and CEO at EZPR, tells "Nightcap's" Jon Sarlin that companies have not been able to articulate a compelling argument for coming back to the office. For more, watch the full Nightcap episode here.

title: US markets suffer worst day of losses since 2020
This Ferrari is the brand's first four-door vehicle
description: Ferrari has unveiled its first four-door vehicle. Although it certainly looks like a crossover SUV, Ferrari says the Purosangue is a car that's made for speed.

title: CNN legal analyst breaks down the four major investigations into Trump
description: CNN's senior legal analyst and former prosecutor Elie Honig breaks down the latest developments in the four major ongoing investigations into former President Donald Trump.

title: Videos of young Black girls reacting to 'Little Mermaid' trailer go viral
description: Disney released the trailer for a new, live-action "The Little Mermaid." Parents shared their Black daughters reacting to Halle Bailey as Ariel, the iconic mermaid.

title: Ramsey Lewis, jazz pianist who revitalized genre, dies at 87
description: Depending on which music pundit you ask, jazz "died" when its 1920s heyday ended. Others believe jazz music lost its luster when the 1960s -- and rock music -- rolled around.

title: Highlights from New York Fashion Week
description: Fashion month returned to New York in a big way, with five-and-a-half-days of in-person runway shows including Gabriela Hearst, Prabal Gurung, LaQuan Smith, Collina Strada and Batsheva, hosted in iconic locations around the city.

title: Where you can drink some of the rarest beers in the world
description: The Raleigh Beer Garden in North Carolina holds the world record for most beers on tap and can serve you beers you can't find anywhere else in the country.

title: Twitter whistleblower responds to Chinese spying allegations
description: The Twitter whistleblower Senate hearing revealed that the FBI allegedly warned Twitter that the company employed a Chinese foreign agent. Hear what Peiter "Mudge" Zatko, the Twitter whistleblower, had to say about it.

title: Twitter shareholders vote in favor of Elon Musk's $44 billion takeover deal
description: Elon Musk may be fighting tooth-and-nail to get out of his deal to buy Twitter, but the social media company's shareholders plan to hold him to it.

title: Sen. Grassley: FBI warned Twitter it may have Chinese agent on payroll
What may have given modern humans an edge over Neanderthals, according to new research
description: From studying fossilized skulls, scientists know that the size of a Neanderthal's brain was the same as, if not slightly bigger than, that of a modern human. However, researchers have known little about Neanderthal brain development because soft tissue doesn't preserve well in the fossil record.

title: CNN reporter: Russians appear to be 'stunned' in wake of Ukraine's counteroffensive
description: Russian losses during Ukraine's counteroffensive are sparking public criticism towards Vladimir Putin, including calls for the Russian President to resign. CNN's Fred Pleitgen reports.

title: Queen's death revives painful memories of British colonialism
description: For some in former British colonies, Queen Elizabeth II's death has sparked powerful emotions, ranging from sadness to anger.

title: Mannerly bear opens and closes front door
description: "Close the door, sweetie ... " The most polite bear ever opens and closes a woman's front door on command. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: Jill Biden says she and President Biden have 'not yet' discussed a possible reelection run
description: First lady Dr. Jill Biden says she has not yet discussed with President Joe Biden whether he will run for a second term.

title: Prince William just inherited a 685-year old estate worth $1 billion
description: Royal wills are never made public. That means what happens to much of the Queen's personal wealth following her death last week will remain a family secret.

title: An extra 8-minute step before crib transfer could be the baby sleep hack you need, study finds
description: It's every parent's nightmare -- an exhausted baby who just won't stop crying when it's time go to sleep. Even worse? The baby finally falls asleep in your arms but wakes again and starts sobbing when laid in the crib.

title: John Lennon's killer Mark David Chapman is denied parole for the 12th time
description: Mark David Chapman, the man who fatally shot John Lennon in 1980, has been denied parole for the 12th time, New York corrections officials told CNN.

title: Kelly Ripa recounts passing out during sex because of ovarian cysts
description: Boy does Kelly Ripa have a story for the world.

title: UN chief says 'fossil fuel free-for-all' must end as report warns world heading in 'wrong direction'
description: The impacts of climate change are "heading into uncharted territories of destruction," UN Secretary General António Guterres warned on Tuesday on the release of a multi-agency scientific report reviewing the latest research on the subject.

title: New Hampshire's GOP primary will complete the Senate battleground map
How Elizabeth II became queen of the Jet Age
House Oversight Committee asks Archives if Trump still possesses presidential records
description: The House Oversight Committee is asking the National Archives for an assessment of whether there are presidential records still unaccounted for and in Donald Trump's possession, according to a new letter obtained by CNN.

title: 'Clerks III' is Kevin Smith's sentimental ode to the movie that launched his career
description: Grappling with middle age, "Clerks III" turns out to be unexpectedly sentimental and nostalgic, reflecting that writer-director-editor-co-star Kevin Smith inherently recognizes this will likely be the gang's final visit to Quick Stop Groceries. If so, it's an uneven if gentle way to hang out the "We're closed" sign.

title: US markets suffer worst day of losses since 2020
Russia's retreat in Ukraine won't save Europe from recession this winter
description: Ukrainian troops have launched a stunning offensive in recent days, recapturing roughly 2,300 square miles of their country's territory with a speed that could force Russian President Vladimir Putin to reconsider his strategy and objectives in the six-month-old war.

title: 'We prayed to be liberated': Inside a city recaptured by Ukraine after months of Russian occupation
description: Burned-out tanks and trucks emblazoned with Russia's signature 'Z' symbol lie at the side of the road, gutted and red with new rust. A collapsed bridge is covered in signs warning of landmines. Further along, the wreckage of a car is left alongside a destroyed petrol station surrounded by the debris of shelling.

title: See what Russians left behind after being run out of city
description: CNN became the first international television crew to enter Izium since the Ukrainians retook it from Russian forces. Izium has now been "liberated," along with almost the whole of Kharkiv region, a Ukrainian military source told CNN. CNN's Sam Kiley reports on why the city is a strategic loss for the Russian military.

title: King Charles III and Camilla visit Northern Ireland as thousands of mourners file past Queen's coffin
description: King Charles III and his wife Camilla, the Queen Consort, arrived in Northern Ireland on Tuesday, as thousands of people continue to file past the Queen's coffin lying in state in Edinburgh.

title: The GOP primary in New Hampshire's 1st District is defined more by style than substance
description: They both worked for Donald Trump and have centered their congressional campaigns on the former President's policies.

title: The Fed is fighting inflation. Could deflation be its next battle?
description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell has a big problem, and he can't do anything about it.

title: Watch 'anomaly' trigger Blue Origin rocket failure
description: A Blue Origin rocket experienced a "booster failure" during an uncrewed launch of its New Shepard rocket, triggering an abort system that allowed the capsule to parachute to earth. CNN space and defense correspondent Kristin Fisher explains how this could impact the company.

title: Mike Trout on the verge of MLB record after hitting a home run in seventh straight game
description: Ten-time Major League Baseball All-Star Mike Trout hit his seventh homer in seven games with a two-run drive in the fifth inning, but it wasn't enough as the Los Angeles Angels fell to the Cleveland Guardians 5-4.

title: Small businesses are feeling slightly better about inflation
description: Small business sentiment improved in August but remains depressed as business owners face an uncertain economic landscape.

title: Jean-Luc Godard, French cinema legend, dies age 91
description: French-Swiss director, Jean-Luc Godard -- a key figure in the Nouvelle Vague, the film-making movement that revolutionized cinema in the late 1950s and 60s -- has died aged 91, French media is reporting.

title: Biden's Delaware vacation home faces 'extreme' flood risk as climate change leads to rising seas
description: As he's traveled the country to visit victims of storms, wildfires, and floods, President Joe Biden has returned to a similar theme: Climate change is "everybody's crisis," as he declared last year after surveying flooded-out New York homes in the wake of Hurricane Ida.

title: New Hampshire's GOP primary will complete the Senate battleground map
description: New Hampshire Republicans are set to choose their candidate to take on Democratic Sen. Maggie Hassan on Tuesday in a primary that will lock in the final key matchup in November's battle for control of the Senate.

title: Analysis: Putin's Kharkiv disaster is his biggest challenge yet. It has left him with few options
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has spent more than two decades carefully cultivating his domestic political image of a strong foreign policy strategist who can outsmart Western leaders and restore Russia to its former glory.

title: Australians are bracing for more pain from rain this summer as third La Niña confirmed
description: Much of Australia will face unusually heavy rains in coming months, the country's weather forecaster said on Tuesday, after confirming that a La Niña weather event is under way for the third year in a row and would likely last into next year.

title: Russell Wilson booed in return to Seattle as Denver Broncos lose to Seahawks
description: He might've brought the Seattle Seahawks their first Super Bowl title, but upon his return to the Pacific Northwest with his new team on Monday, Russell Wilson certainly didn't get a hero's welcome.

title: After years of food addiction, record-breaking strongwoman Tamara Walcott says powerlifting 'saved me from myself'
description: Tamara Walcott can still remember the first time she set foot in a powerlifting gym: the chalked hands, the strapped wrists, the yells and screams as lifters heaved weights off the floor.

title: See Russians react to Ukraine's dramatic territory gains
description: As Kyiv pushes on with its counteroffensive, Russian troops are retreating from the occupied territory in Ukraine in one of the biggest defeats of the invasion. CNN's Matthew Chance reports on how Russians are reacting to the battlefield losses.

title: Supreme Court justices respond to public criticism with distance and denial
description: The Supreme Court's obliteration of nearly 50 years of abortion rights for women, along with its new, tougher stance on gun control and other politically charged rulings, have stained the image of an impartial judiciary.

title: 'Keep talking': How a simple philosophy helped lead to a White House celebration
description: Steve Ricchetti never stopped talking to Joe Manchin.

title: Why are some people fearing Liverpool fans might boo minute's silence for Queen Elizabeth?
description: Liverpool faces Ajax in the UEFA Champions League on Tuesday, but the standout question to Reds manager Jurgen Klopp ahead of this match was not about his team's poor form but whether fans would respect a minute's silence for Queen Elizabeth II.

title: Hear from Jacinda Ardern on whether New Zealand will become a republic
description: New Zealand's Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said she expects her country to eventually become a republic, but it's not going to happen soon. New Zealand is one of the Commonwealth countries to count the British monarch as the ceremonial head of state. Former New Zealand Prime Minister Helen Clark joins CNN's Becky Anderson to discuss.

title: Workers at two big British ports to strike later this month
description: Workers at Britain's biggest container port Felixstowe plan to stage a second eight-day strike over pay, the Unite union said on Tuesday, adding to a wave of industrial unrest caused by soaring inflation.

title: Map explainer: How Ukraine pulled off counteroffensive in the east
description: Ukraine's counteroffensive has reshaped the war with Russia. CNN's Clare Sebastian discusses with Neil Melvin, director of International Security Studies of RUSI.

title: 24 hours of mini-golf: The quartet who crushed a world record to raise money for Kentucky flood victims
description: On a balmy July morning at a small mini-golf center in northern Kentucky, four local regulars tapped their opening strokes.

title: NBA player Anthony Edwards apologizes for insensitive social media post as league is 'reviewing the matter'
description: Minnesota Timberwolves guard Anthony Edwards has apologized for a recent social media post in which he used homophobic language.

title: Municipal deputies from Moscow and St. Petersburg call for Putin's resignation
All four of Queen Elizabeth II's children hold vigil at her coffin
California's raging Mosquito Fire destroys 25 homes before pushing deeper into forested areas, sending smoke into Nevada
description: Burning intensely and choking the air with smoke, California's raging Mosquito Fire has destroyed 25 homes and continues its unrelenting spread through dry forests in the Sierra Nevada mountains.

title: Justice Department subpoena storm broadens Trump's potential legal woes
description: A strikingly broad subpoena sweep against more than 30 former officials and campaign aides of ex-President Donald Trump represents the clearest sign yet of the seriousness of the Department of Justice's criminal probe into events surrounding the US Capitol insurrection.

title: Municipal deputies call for Putin's resignation
Poor leadership and hardware maintenance issues among the flaws that have trickled out over the more than seven months of war in Ukraine so far
description: For Russia, the numbers are catastrophic.

title: Clashes erupt along Armenia-Azerbaijan border, potentially reigniting an old conflict
description: A decades-old conflict may be on the verge of reigniting, as reports emerged this week of attacks along the border between Azerbaijan and Armenia.

title: 'Succession' and 'Ted Lasso' reign, while 'The White Lotus' cleans up at the Emmys
Pakistan 'still in danger' and flooding may take up to 6 months to recede, authorities say
description: Authorities in Pakistan have warned it could take up to six months for deadly flood waters to recede in the country's hardest-hit areas, as fears rise over the threat posed by waterborne diseases including cholera and dengue.

title: Activist jailed for two years for insulting Thailand's queen
description: A Thai court sentenced a political activist to two years in prison on Monday for insulting the monarchy, her lawyer said, after the activist was judged to have dressed as Queen Suthida during a street protest the court ruled mocked the royal family.

title: 'Succession' and 'Ted Lasso' reign, while 'The White Lotus' cleans up at the Emmys
description: "Succession" and "Ted Lasso" emerged as returning champions at the 74th annual Emmy Awards, on a night that tilted toward repeat winners while spreading the wealth in a way that appeared to celebrate diversity among talent, platforms and content.

title: A look into how Camilla became Queen Consort
description: With the passing of Queen Elizabeth II, Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall, assumed her new role as Queen Consort. CNN's Randi Kaye explains Camilla's complicated history with the royal family.

title: The Queen's corgis have a new home
description: Queen Elizabeth II is reported to have had over 30 corgis during her lifetime. CNN's Tom Foreman reports on who will care for the late Queen's dogs following her passing.

title: Former Clinton investigator reacts to Trump's classified documents fight
description: David Laufman, a former Justice Department counterintelligence chief who investigated former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton's possession of classified documents, reacts to more than 30 subpoenas issued to people in former President Donald Trump's orbit and the former president's ongoing fight against the DOJ over the appointment of a special master to oversee the agency's Mar-a-Lago investigation.

title: Dining at 1,820 feet, in South Korea's highest restaurant
description: The journey to the highest restaurant in South Korea starts with a whale display.

title: Nurses claim largest strike in industry history as 15K walk off jobs
description: Minnesota nurses went on strike from 13 hospitals, arguing for better staffing and better care for their patients.

title: NASA pushes back date for next Artemis I rocket launch attempt
description: Officials at NASA are pushing back the next launch attempt for its Artemis I mega moon rocket by four days to September 27, the space agency announced Monday.
